column4: Nickrud, bulmer: What are disabled when I run gnome on failsafe?  I don't have that error when I go to failsafe
I don't know, sorry. I've never really looked at the session startup stuff
grep  (and think about installing beagle, I find it Worked For Meâ„¢
doesn't beagle come with Gibbon?
I thought it was using tracker
whatever it was, it was useless
how do I use grep to search a directory recursively
grep -r (recursive)
how do I start beagle after it's installed?
system->preferences->session , look for it in the Startup Programs tab
thanks
I found the culprit to my gnome problem in a file in /etc/X11/Xsessions.d, can I just delete it outright?
which one?
it's called 60xvnkb_startup, seems to be added by that program
or is there a way to rename it so that it doesn't run on startup?
try apt-get -r --purge xvnkb (or the actual package name). Manually changing files in /etc is something you need to be exactly sure about what you are doing
you could try moving it out of that dir ( files in *.d dirs in /etc are all read, you can't stop it)
do you mean -remove instead of -r? it doesn't understand -r
heh. I'm into aptitude, sudo aptitude purge xvnkb
thanks, I'll try logging back in and see if that solves my problem
looks good, that file seems to have been deleted
apt-get remove (I reread the man page;P) will leave files in /etc (in case you had altered them) and --purge will remove them, fyi
Yay, it worked.  Thanks for your help.
there's instructions somewhere on the forums
